column4: Okay, I believe I found the problem in booting ubuntu's installer. It's crashing after loading USB devices. However, I tried turning off the USB probing in the boot options... but it's still doing it!
how much ram is in your box?
are you _sure_ about the exact figure of 120?
b/c that's less then the graphical installer's minimum requirements
you need at least 128 to run that
get the alternate install for your particular situation
...well that's a horse of a different color
do you happen to know what chipset your usb ports use?
and when you say CRASHING what is it saying?
try turning it off in your bios?
It's an IBM Thinkpad iSeries... hold on
I've got a thinkpad r60e.... several options here
there should be an option to shut off usb
in my bios, I can change date/time, boot order, speedstep, and that's literally all :p
I've tried to turn off usb probing via boot options, but for some crazy reason it seems to be ignoring that option and doing it anyway
